p.span: Creates Concept(s) for an existing Context with specified parameters.

xsCreateConcept conceptName FROM Context [IN container] [BY class] [SCOPED scope] WITH points=double[,double]+ [shape=(pi|trapezoid|triangle|curveincrease|curvedescrease|linearincrease|lineardecrease)] [; points=double[,double]+ [shape=(pi|trapezoid|triangle|curveincrease|curvedescrease|linearincrease|lineardecrease)] ]*
| xsCreateConcept teeny FROM Height WITH points="0,40" shape=pi scope=app
Creates a concept called 'teeny' in the context 'Height' with a value range of 0 to 40.
concept, container, class, points, scope, shape
The name of the new concept.
The name of the context that contains the concept.
The name of the container that contains the context.

The values describing the shape to be graphed. There must be at least 2 points (min, max). Each shape supports a different number of points (linear has 2 points, min and max; curve supports 3 points, min, inflection point, max; pi supports 5 points, min, inflection left, center, inflection right, max; trapezoid supports 4 points, min, topleft, topright, max; triangle supports 3 points, min, top, max).

html.p: The scope (private, app, global) where the container is stored..
The shape of the concept. This defaults to pi.

p.span: The concept created by xsCreateConcept is displayed in table or chart format. See xsDisplayConcept for details about display of the created Concept.

html.p:
